results.name: Sum of digits of n written in fractional base 4/3.
comment: The base 4/3 expansion is unique and thus the sum of digits function is well-defined.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: In base 4/3 the number 14 is represented by 3212 and so a(14) = 3 + 2 + 1 + 2 = 8.
mathematica: p:=4; q:=3; a[n_]:= a[n]= If[n==0, 0, a[q*Floor[n/p]] + Mod[n, p]]; Table[a[n], {n,0,75}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 20 2019 *)
program: vector(75, n, n--; a(n)) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 20 2019
